thread.title: Mattis says U.S. service members in DACA will generally not be deported

title: Mattis says U.S. service members in DACA will generally not be deported
text:
38 PM / in 26 minutes Mattis says U.S. service members in DACA will generally not be deported Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Defense Secretary Jim Mattis said on Thursday that service members in the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, or DACA, program will not be deported, other than a few exceptions. 
“We would always stand by one of our people,” Mattis told reporters. He added that the only exception was if the service member had committed a “serious” felony or a federal judge had signed deportation orders. 
Until now, the fate of about 800 service members in the program had not been clear. Reporting by Idrees Ali; Editing by James Dalgleish
